text:
Thanks Chris and Jacob, I'll experiment as such.

<@U05CJMDM467> - yes I do.
hi, not so much! We decided not to go with a script as of now, but Iâ€™d keep updated if there are any changes :slightly_smiling_face:
I think Bashir might be on to something with the custom coded workflow - which is to set a delay in there.
Maybe, you'd have to store this in another system though as all contacts would hit that custom coded action at once and potentially cause a cascade of HubSpot secondly limits
I think another option I have is to automate the enrollment using some code sitting outside of HubSpot, so that massive batches don't get added at once.
You could do something really unhinged and assign each one a sequenced number and feed it through in a delay while cycling through them individually, but that is likely significantly more work.
Can Delay be dynamic like that? I thought I only saw options for static delays?
Na, you'd have to handle that in the js
Let us know what you come up with, I'd be interested in your solve.
